name: dismemberment
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] the action of cutting, tearing, or pulling the arms and legs off a body: dismemberment of He was charged with the murder and dismemberment of his neighbour. He had witnessed public hangings and dismemberments.
[ U ] literary the action of dividing a country or organization into different parts: dismemberment of the empire He protested vigorously against the dismemberment of the empire. See
dismember
More examplesFewer examplesThere were offences which, in former ages, were punishable by dismemberment.The film contains horrific scenes of decapitations and dismemberments.He was the leader who presided over the dismemberment of Yugoslavia.AT&T was this country's undisputed telecom monopoly until its dismemberment by court order in 1984.The ministry is too big and cries out for dismemberment.
